# Our 2020 Election Guide

<div class="css-zkk2wn">

Updated  Sept. 11, 2020

</div>

-----

<div class="css-1yyoic1">

</div>

  - ## The Latest
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        Joe Biden and President Trump put [hostilities on hold today to
        travel to ground zero and then to Shanksville, Pa., where they
        separately honored 9/11
        victims](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/09/11/us/politics/shanksville-trump-biden.html).

  - ## How to Win 270
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        Joe Biden and Donald Trump need 270 electoral votes to reach the
        White House. Try building [your own coalition of battleground
        states](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/us/elections/election-states-biden-trump.html) to
        see potential outcomes.

  - ## Voting by Mail
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        Will you have enough time to vote by mail in your state? Yes,
        but it’s risky to procrastinate. [Check your state’s
        deadline.](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/08/31/us/politics/vote-by-mail-deadlines.html)
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        <div class="css-1bzoy3k">
        
        [![](data:image/png;base64,)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/us/elections/joe-biden.html)
        
        # Joe Biden
        
        ## Democrat
        
        [![](data:image/png;base64,)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/us/elections/donald-trump.html)
        
        # Donald Trump
        
        ## Republican
        
        </div>

## Vote By Mail

1.  ![<span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Anna
    Moneymaker for The New York
    Times</span>](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/09/09/us/politics/09dc-postal/merlin_176112309_3aca400a-1e05-4e1b-ada3-8b6e3c78bd01-videoLarge.jpg)
    
    <div class="css-10wtrbd">
    
    ## [Postal Service to Tap Republican Lobbyist to Quell Mounting Scrutiny](/2020/09/09/us/postal-service-lobbyist.html)
    
    Facing multiple investigations and calls for his ouster, the
    postmaster general turned to a G.O.P. lobbyist viewed as adept at
    reaching out to
    Democrats.
    
    <span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j">By
    <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Kenneth P. Vogel</span>,
    <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Hailey Fuchs</span> and
    <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Luke
    Broadwater</span></span>
    
    </div>

2.  ![<span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Photo
    Illustration by The New York Times; Rodrigo Abd/Associated
    Press</span>](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/09/09/us/politics/09onpolitics-pm/09onpolitics-pm-videoLarge.jpg)
    
    <div class="css-10wtrbd">
    
    ## [What We Don’t Know About 2020](/2020/09/09/us/politics/what-we-dont-know-about-2020.html)
    
    With less than eight weeks to go until Election Day, a number of
    factors could still shake the
    race.

3.  ![<span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Mark
    Makela for The New York
    Times</span>](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/09/09/us/politics/09doublevoting1/09doublevoting1-videoLarge-v2.jpg)
    
    <div class="css-10wtrbd">
    
    ## [Is Voting Twice a Felony?](/article/voting-twice.html)
    
    President Trump suggested that North Carolina voters mail in their
    ballots and show up in person to test the state’s electoral system.
    What exactly are the consequences of voting
    twice?
    
    <span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j">By
    <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Nick Corasaniti</span> and
    <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Stephanie

    ### <span class="css-m70j1g">White house memo</span>
    
    ## For a President Who ‘Needs to Touch the Flame,’ Bob Woodward Was Irresistible

    journalist, gambling that he could control the narrative. Instead,
    he undermined himself shortly before an election.

    Baker</span>
